description.line1: An UI/UX designer with meticulous eyes for detail.
description.line2: Dedicated to shaping intuitive experiences where technology meets human needs.

elevate.title: Elevate
elevate.description: Bridging the gap between product design teams and users with disabilities.

rocketEngine.title: Rocket Engine Catalog
rocketEngine.description: An interface that eliminates the barrier between everyday people and the complex world of rocket engines.

Sandbox.header: THIS IS WHERE I EXPLORE A BIT......

Elevate.title: Elevate
Elevate.description: Elevate is a data-driven platform that bridges the gap between product teams and users with disabilities through a dynamic accessibility scoring system, transforming traditional compliance-based testing into continuous, actionable feedback that drives both business value and meaningful inclusion.

intro.part3: where user experiences shape accessibility scores and drive better design.

questions.question1: What is this accessibility score and feedback loop?
questions.question3: And why do we need it?

theProblem.title: The Problem
theProblem.description: Despite our best effort in trying to improve accessibility practices, users with disabilities continue to face barriers that compliance alone fails to address.

primaryResearch.title: Primary Research
primaryResearch.description: We interviewed 4 industry professionals, 2 caretakers, and 3 from the users perspective using synthetic users, and here is what we have learned.

insight1.title: Insight 1
insight1.description: More than 2/3 of the people we interviewed stress the importance of ongoing accessibility collaboration and feedback , but resource constraints and sensitivity concerns frequently limit this process to just the initial interactions .
insight1.quote1: It's a missed opportunity, really, that we don't get to do more of that type of stuff (accessibility audits). Because I think in general we would learn a lot more by doing it regularly.
insight1.quote2: To better understand and accommodate my needs, ongoing dialogue is essential.

insight2.title: Insight 2
insight2.description: While experts emphasize leadership-driven accessibility and team-wide disability awareness , only 36% of companies have secured genuine top-down commitment to digital accessibility.
insight2.quote1: When leadership is involved, it empowers everyone to be more considerate and proactive, making sure accessibility isn't just an afterthought.
insight2.quote2: When leadership prioritizes accessibility, it sets the tone for the entire organization.
insight2.quote3: It's empowering when professionals view me as a partner in the process of enhancing accessibility, acknowledging the expertise.

whyAndHow.title: Why & How
whyAndHow.intro: Basically it comes down to these two issues:

issue1.title: Lack of accessibility awareness
points: Functionality of a product always comes first
Low accessibility awareness from both product leaders and the design team
Misconception that accessibility features only benefit a small percentage of users
False belief that accessibility can be "added later" rather than built from the start
issue1.hmw: make accessibility impact measurable and visible to both product teams and the public to drive awareness of its importance?

issue2.title: Lack of ongoing collaboration
points: Difficult to find the means and resources
Unintentional barriers between the design team and individuals with disabilities
issue2.hmw: support design teams and individuals with disabilities in building sustainable, strengthening relationships throughout the product lifecycle?

scoreDashboard.title: Score Dashboard
scoreDashboard.description: The accessibility score dashboard displays a comprehensive score derived from three preliminary metrics:
scoreDashboard.note: ( Measuring methods will be explained in the next section )
scoreDashboard.conclusion: The combination of these metrics provides a holistic measure of a product's accessibility performance.

mainDashboard.title: Main Dashboard
mainDashboard.description: The "Embed Score" feature allows teams to showcase their accessibility commitment across platforms, raising public awareness while celebrating inclusive design.

productAmbassador.title: Product Ambassador
productAmbassador.description1: The platform maintains a network of Product Ambassadors - primarily users with disabilities, but open to all users who can provide valuable accessibility feedback
productAmbassador.description2: The method of becoming a product ambassador will be a separate design initiative.

tickets.title: Tickets
tickets.description1: The Tickets Dashboard tracks all incoming accessibility improvement requests.
tickets.description2: While Product Ambassadors form our core testing network providing regular, consistent feedback, any user can submit tickets to enhance product accessibility.

sprintManager.title: Sprint Manager
sprintManager.description1: Tickets transform into tasks, and fall under a sprint, with potential Jira API integration to streamline workflow.
sprintManager.description2: However, these specialized sprints uniquely measure both task completion and user-verified accessibility impact.

roadmap.title: Roadmap
roadmap.description: Elavate sprints extend beyond traditional completion through five key stages:
roadmap.conclusion: After changes are implemented, affected users receive surveys to assess the improvements. Their feedback not only updates the product's accessibility score but can also generate new improvement tickets - creating a continuous cycle where each solution's effectiveness is verified and refined by actual user experience.

survey.title: Survey
survey.description1: The Survey Dashboard displays active sprints and prompts available actions.
survey.description2: Positive responses enhance the product's accessibility score, while all feedback contributes to continuous improvement through potential new tickets.

loop.intro: In this way, a feedback loop is created
benefits: Forms sustainable connections between product teams and users, breaking down communication barriers
Enables teams to adapt to evolving user needs through continuous validation
Bridges the gap between technical compliance and real user experience
Transforms sporadic accessibility testing into continuous improvement

RocketEngineCatalog.title: Rocket Engine Catalog
RocketEngineCatalog.description:
This project focuses on designing a user-friendly interface for a rocket engine database, making complex technical information engaging and digestible for the general public.
The interface features a clear visual style and intuitive flow, inviting users to play, explore, and discover different engine types, specifications, and components.

engineFactory.title: ENGINE FACTORY
engineFactory.subtitle: Home Page
engineFactory.centralHub: Home page is the central hub that leads to other levels

fabricationShop.title: FABRICATION SHOP
fabricationShop.subtitle: Landing Page
fabricationShop.description: This is the start of where users can "build their own engine", and then select existing engines based on their decisions.

buildingEngine.title: Part 1 - Building the engine
buildingEngine.description1: Users can start from either one of the three main options that makes up a rocket engine.
buildingEngine.description2: The interface will then guide the user to complete all three before continuing to further customizations.

buildSummary.description1: After all three has been selected, the user will be shown a summary of all their selections and further configure their engine.
buildSummary.description2: After they are happy with their build, they can proceed to the selection area.

selectingEngine.title: Part 2 - Selecting your engine
selectingEngine.description1: Based on the user's selected configuration, the system will display a list of existing engines that match their requirements.
selectingEngine.description2: Once the user has identified an engine they are interested in, they can proceed to the Hangar Bay (Details Page) to view more information about that specific engine.

hangerBay.title: HANGER BAY
hangerBay.subtitle: Details Page
hangerBay.description1: Selections the user have made that lead to this result
hangerBay.description2: More detailed information about the engine, as well as the rocket it serves
hangerBay.description4: Featured engines that leads you to other parts of the Hanger Bay.

futurePlans.title: FUTURE PLANS
futurePlans.subtitle: Hanger Bay
futurePlans.description1: In my plan, Hanger Bay is like a library, but for rocket engines. That is why all the details of any engine leads you to this page.
futurePlans.description2: But it does not have to be just a boring library. It could include -
futurePlans.trainingDescription1: Training is an area on the map that provides users with additional information on more complicated concepts when they become interested in these topics after using the site.
futurePlans.trainingDescription2: Progression system that incentivize users to do these trainings and be more educated on rocket engines and how they work

features.item3: Swipe support for switching between parts of the build

DroneNet.title: DroneNet
DroneNet.description: DroneNet is an app designed for FPV (First-Person View) drone pilots to connect, share, and ensure the legality and safety of their flying locations. This platform addresses the unique challenges faced by FPV enthusiasts, providing a community-driven space where pilots can confidently explore new spots and share their experiences

homePageSection.title: Home Page
homePageSection.description1: The spot map shows all locations a pilot has flown at and posted about. These locations can be viewed both on the map and in an expandable list that includes detailed information.
homePageSection.description2: Map indicators show whether pilots encountered issues when flying at each location, based on user-reported data.

createPost.title: Create Post
createPost.description: When uploading, users can add location and gear details that display with their video. An optional survey presented during preview determines the location's indicator bar.

communityPostsAndPeople.title: Community Posts and People
communityPostsAndPeople.description: Community space displaying other pilots' posts in a list view. Check out pilot profiles and view the gear they used, which may lead to item sales for a similar gear.

itemSales.title: Item Sales
itemSales.description: Local gear sales encourage pilot connections by facilitating meetups with fellow enthusiasts in the area.

userProfile.title: User Profile
userProfile.description: In your profile, you can view personal information, tags, followers, posts, managing gear presets and spots you plan to visit.
